name: Sunday Late Night Free Improvisation Ambient Jam with Petal Loop
description: Monthly ambient jam led by Ray Sun

name: CYBEX Stroll Together Walk - Yorkville
description:
Join CYBEX and storyteller (and parent of two!) Sarain Fox for a community event to support maternal mental health and combat postpartum loneliness.

Did you know that 82% of pregnant and postpartum individuals experience loneliness? This isolation can seriously affect their mental health - and in turn, their child’s well-being. So, for this Maternal Mental Health Month, let’s change that, one step at a time.

Bring your little ones and come out for a leisurely walk, meet other parents, connect with host Sarain Fox, and build community together. CYBEX will donate $100 per registered walk (up to $10,000) to the charity Life With a Baby and all participants will be entered to win one of five prize packages.

organizer.name: Craft Public Relations on the behalf of CYBEZ

name: Step Into My Shoes - An Exhibition
description: Explore this captivating photographic series by Anahita Khalilian, in collaboration with photographer Riley Stewart. The series delves into the intersection of fashion, identity, and disability, showcasing Khalilian's collection of bold high heels. Through striking imagery, it challenges perceptions and celebrates empowerment, resilience, and triumph over adversity.

name: Red Dress Exhibit | Msko-mjigoodenh Zhinoomaagewin

location.name: Gould Street (between Bond St. and Church St.)

description:
May 5th is Red Dress Day | Msko-mjigoodenh Giizhigad, also known as the National Day of Awareness for Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women, Girls and Two-Spirit People (MMIWG2S). The day is designated to honour the memories of missing and murdered Indigenous women, girls and Two-Spirit people across Turtle Island. Visible reminders of this day are symbolized by hanging red dresses in windows, on balconies or in trees. 

This year at TMU, we are commemorating this day by having our second annual outdoor Red Dress Exhibit. The exhibit will be a visible reminder, bringing forth awareness of the targeted gendered and racialized crimes against the Indigenous Peoples. All community members are invited to visit and observe.
